title: A Step-by-Step Gide to Setting a Title in HTML

steps.title: Open a text editing program (or IDE) such as Atom, Brackets, or even TextEdit or Notepad++.
steps.content: Open a text editing program (or IDE) such as Atom, Brackets, or even TextEdit or Notepad++.

steps.title: Create the <html> body.
steps.content: Create the <html> body. Using the <html> tags, create a .html file with either tag on a new line. Make sure to close the tag with </html> .

steps.title: Add the <head> section.
steps.content: Add the <head> section. Placing the <head> tags in between the <html> tags, define the head (metadata section) section. Make sure to close the tag with </head> .

steps.title: Add the <body> section.
steps.content: Add the <body> section. Below the closing </head> tag and above the closing </html> tag, add the <body> (content section) tags. Make sure to close the tag with </body> . Optionally, add some 'test' code in the body (or content) section to make sure that you've coded it correctly. If the content shows, it means that the code is parsing (loading). If not, it means that you may have made a typo or some other thing that is not letting it load.

steps.title: Add a <title> tag in the head (metadata) section.
steps.content: Add a <title> tag in the head (metadata) section. Make sure to close the tag with </title> . These two tags can be on the same line. In between the starting and closing title tags, write what you want your title to say.

steps.title: Save your file to an easily accessible location.
steps.content: Save your file to an easily accessible location. Name your file as something.html , replacing something with what you wish. Remember that the index.html file is the 'home' or 'landing' page of your website.

steps.title: Open your page in your preferred browser.
steps.content: Open your page in your preferred browser. Browsers like Google Chrome, or Mozilla Firefox are good for front-end website development. Go ahead and open your .html file. You can use short keys like âŒ˜ Cmd + O or Ctrl + O to open the file in most browsers.

steps.title: Look at the top of the tab for your title.
steps.content: Look at the top of the tab for your title. If your desired title shows, the code has loaded and worked! If not, and it shows your filename instead (something.html), you may have made a mistake; check your code for typos then try again.

steps.title: Sit back and admire your work.
steps.content: Sit back and admire your work. You've just taken the first step to a fully functional website.
